page.title: 01Skibo and Clashmore
page.content: Skibo Castle and its estate, until recently including Clashmore and Clashmore Woods, donimate here. The castle is just S of the A9 but not visible from the road which runs W to E across the middle of the block. On this road is Clashmore, an attractive late 18th C. village with many fine old trees; it was built when the woods to the N were planted by a former proprietor of Skibo. The castle, much enlarged around 1900 by Andrew Carnegie, stands on an escarpment looking S over parkland to the Dornoch Firth and hills beyond. Below it are Loch Ospisdale, a fishing loch, and Loch Skibo, an arm of the Dornoch Firth, where sea trout and salmon com in to the mouth of the River Evelix. Ospreys nest here.
